reasoning: New frontend component following existing patterns. Backend APIs already exist. Multiple files but contained to frontend with no external integrations or infrastructure changes.

scope.notes: New timeline component, date filter component, tests, and updates to existing pages. All changes contained to frontend inspection views.

integrations.notes: Uses existing APIs (GET /projects/{id}/inspections) and MUI components. No external integrations required.

infrastructure.notes: Frontend-only feature. Backend inspection APIs, models, and schemas already exist and include all required data (inspector, consultant_type, status, dates).

knowledge.notes: Similar timeline component already exists (InspectionHistoryTimeline for audit events). Can follow existing patterns for MUI components, date filtering, and API integration.

concerns: Status mapping: Need to correctly map backend statuses (pending/in_progress/completed/failed) to design spec (PASSED/FAILED/PENDING)
Date filtering: Ensure date range filter performs well with many inspections
Responsive design: Timeline must work on mobile/tablet
Distinction: Two different timeline components exist - one for audit events, one for inspection list
risk.notes: Read-only UI feature with no security implications. Backend APIs tested and stable. Main risk is UI/UX implementation details.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: New UI component with data fetching and filtering logic requires unit tests for component behavior and integration tests for API interactions. No security-sensitive code involved (read-only display).

implementation_notes.existing_vs_new: Existing InspectionHistoryTimeline shows audit events for a SINGLE inspection. Design spec requires a NEW component showing a timeline of ALL inspections. Two different use cases.
implementation_notes.design_reference: design-assets/inspection/25-history-timeline.png shows vertical timeline with inspector avatars, inspection types, status badges (PASSED/FAILED/PENDING), and date range filter.
implementation_notes.backend_ready: Backend APIs fully implemented. GET /projects/{project_id}/inspections returns all required data including created_by user, consultant_type, status, and dates.
